functions.name: rmd-theme-tone
functions.description: Determines if a provided color is considered light or dark.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme-contrast-tone
usedBy.description:
Determines if the provided color should have a light or dark contrast using the
luminance algorithm to maintain a required contrast ratio for accessibility.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color to test.

parameters.name: min-contrast
parameters.description:
The minimum contrast that should be applied. The min
    contrast for normal text should be 4.5 while large or 14px bold text should be 3.1. See
    the link for contrasts for more information.

returns.description: The string 'light' if the color is considered light, otherwise 'dark'.

functions.name: rmd-theme-contrast-tone
functions.description:
Determines if the provided color should have a light or dark contrast using the
luminance algorithm to maintain a required contrast ratio for accessibility.

usedBy.name: rmd-states-opacities
usedBy.description:
Gets the states opacity map based on the provided color. This will check the contrast
tone of the themed color, and return the correct opacities for a dark or light color.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color to test.

parameters.name: min-contrast
parameters.description:
The minimum contrast that should be applied. The min
    contrast for normal text should be 4.5 while large or 14px bold text should be 3.1. See
    the link for contrasts for more information.

returns.description:
The string 'dark' if the color is considered light, or 'light' if the
    color is considered dark.

functions.name: rmd-theme-get-swatch
functions.description:
A theme utility function to convert a material design color to the same color but with a different
swatch. If your app is not using material design colors, this utility function is useless but you
will need to define fallback colors so compliation does not fail.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The material design color to create a new color for with the provided swatch.

parameters.name: swatch
parameters.description:
The swatch to apply. This should be one of `$rmd-theme-primary-suffixes` or
  `$rmd-theme-accent-suffixes` if the `$accent` param is enabled.

parameters.name: accent
parameters.description: Boolean if the swatch is an accent color instead of a primary color.

parameters.name: fallback-color
parameters.description:
The color to fallback to if the `$color` is not a valid
  material design color. Since this is null by default, the complilation will fail until a valid
  fallback is provided.

parameters.name: fallback-name
parameters.description:
The name of a variable or global variable that should be set to
  automatically fix the compilation error.

returns.description: the new color within the same color family with the provided swatch and optional accent.

functions.name: rmd-theme
functions.description:
A small utility function to get a color from the current theme. This is normally used along with the
`rmd-theme-var` function so that both css variables and a fallback can be applied.

You are _most_ likely looking for the `rmd-theme` mixin and not the functions instead.

see.name: rmd-theme-var
see.description:
A small utility function to get a color from the current theme as a css variable. This is normally used along with the
`rmd-theme` function so that both css variables and a fallback can be applied.

You are _most_ likely looking for the `rmd-theme` mixin and not the functions instead.

see.name: rmd-theme-property-values
see.description:
A Map of all the theme property values that can be used throughout the app. This is mainly created
so that the specific `rmd-theme--NAME` classes can be created, but also for the `rmd-theme-prop-value` function
to get a specific color within your theme.

see.name: rmd-theme
see.description:
A small utility function to get a color from the current theme. This is normally used along with the
`rmd-theme-var` function so that both css variables and a fallback can be applied.

You are _most_ likely looking for the `rmd-theme` mixin and not the functions instead.

usedBy.name: react-md-button
usedBy.description: Creates all the styles for buttons within react-md.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme-var
usedBy.description:
A small utility function to get a color from the current theme as a css variable. This is normally used along with the
`rmd-theme` function so that both css variables and a fallback can be applied.

You are _most_ likely looking for the `rmd-theme` mixin and not the functions instead.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme
usedBy.description: This is really for internal use with the `react-md-theme` mixin, but you might be able to use it for some other stuff.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: The theme style to get. This should be one of the keys from `$rmd-theme-property-values`.

functions.name: rmd-theme-var
functions.description:
A small utility function to get a color from the current theme as a css variable. This is normally used along with the
`rmd-theme` function so that both css variables and a fallback can be applied.

You are _most_ likely looking for the `rmd-theme` mixin and not the functions instead.

see.name: rmd-theme
see.description:
A small utility function to get a color from the current theme. This is normally used along with the
`rmd-theme-var` function so that both css variables and a fallback can be applied.

You are _most_ likely looking for the `rmd-theme` mixin and not the functions instead.

see.name: rmd-theme-property-values
see.description:
A Map of all the theme property values that can be used throughout the app. This is mainly created
so that the specific `rmd-theme--NAME` classes can be created, but also for the `rmd-theme-prop-value` function
to get a specific color within your theme.

usedBy.name: react-md-button
usedBy.description: Creates all the styles for buttons within react-md.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme
usedBy.description: This is really for internal use with the `react-md-theme` mixin, but you might be able to use it for some other stuff.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: The theme style to get. This should be one of the keys from `$rmd-theme-property-values`.

functions.name: rmd-theme-prop-value
functions.description:
Attempts to get a specific theme color based on the property provided.

If the property is a color or 'currentColor', it will be returned instead.

NOTE: This has to be defined in variables so there aren't recursive imports.

usedBy.name: rmd-elevation
usedBy.description: Create the box shadow based on a z-value.

usedBy.name: rmd-states-opacities
usedBy.description:
Gets the states opacity map based on the provided color. This will check the contrast
tone of the themed color, and return the correct opacities for a dark or light color.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property to get from the theme colors.

returns.description: a color value for the provided property.

mixins.name: rmd-theme
mixins.description: This is really for internal use with the `react-md-theme` mixin, but you might be able to use it for some other stuff.

usedBy.name: rmd-app-bar
usedBy.description: Creates the styles for the `AppBar` component.

usedBy.name: react-md-button
usedBy.description: Creates all the styles for buttons within react-md.

usedBy.name: rmd-icon-font
usedBy.description: Creates the base styles for a font icon.

usedBy.name: rmd-icon-svg
usedBy.description: Creates the base styles for an svg icon.

usedBy.name: react-md-link
usedBy.description:
Creates the styles for links within react-md. Please note that there are **no disabled styles** unless you
set the href to an empty string. This is intentional. If you want to disable a link, you should remove set
the href to an empty string instead.

usedBy.name: rmd-list
usedBy.description: Creates the styles for a list.

usedBy.name: rmd-list-item
usedBy.description: Creates the styles for a list item.

usedBy.name: rmd-sheet-base
usedBy.description: Creates the base styles for a sheet.

usedBy.name: rmd-states-base-color
usedBy.description:
Applies the base color for the different states to use. The different
states will apply different opacity values to this value.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description:
This is normally `color` or `background-color`, but any valid CSS property that accepts
    color values can be used.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description:
The type of theme style to use. This should be one of the `$rmd-theme-property-values` or a literal
    color value.

parameters.name: important
parameters.description:
Boolean if the !important flag should also be applied. It is generally recommended
    to not use this flag.

parameters.name: edge-opt-out
parameters.description:
Boolean whether to feature-detect around Edge to avoid emitting
    CSS variables for it. This is really only intended for use cases where interactions with pseudo-element styles cause
    problems due to Edge bugs.

mixins.name: rmd-theme-set-var
mixins.description:
This is an extremely simple mixin that will allow you to quickly set or update the value of a theme css variable
with the new provided value.

usedBy.name: react-md-theme
usedBy.description:
Creates all the styles for a theme in react-md. This will start by creating CSS Variables
for each theme variable and then create class names for each variable.

parameters.name: theme-style
parameters.description:
The react-md theme style to update. This should be one of the keys of
    `$rmd-theme-property-values` map.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The updated color value to apply.

mixins.name: react-md-theme
mixins.description:
Creates all the styles for a theme in react-md. This will start by creating CSS Variables
for each theme variable and then create class names for each variable.

examples.code:
// if you want to create a theme without using the `$rmd-theme-primary` and `$rmd-theme-secondary` variables
@include react-md-theme($rmd-teal-500, $rmd-pink-a-400);

parameters.name: primary-color
parameters.description: The primary color to use to theme your app.

parameters.name: secondary-color
parameters.description: The secondary color to use to theme your app.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme-tone
usedBy.description: Determines if a provided color is considered light or dark.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme-tone
usedBy.description: Determines if a provided color is considered light or dark.

variables.name: rmd-theme-color-map
variables.description:
This is a map of all the material design base colors so that you can programmatically get
variables with the neat sass-map functions.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme-get-swatch
usedBy.description:
A theme utility function to convert a material design color to the same color but with a different
swatch. If your app is not using material design colors, this utility function is useless but you
will need to define fallback colors so compliation does not fail.

  rmd-blue-grey-200: $rmd-blue-grey-200,
  rmd-blue-grey-300: $rmd-blue-grey-300,
  rmd-blue-grey-400: $rmd-blue-grey-400,
  rmd-blue-grey-500: $rmd-blue-grey-500,
  rmd-blue-grey-600: $rmd-blue-grey-600,
  rmd-blue-grey-700: $rmd-blue-grey-700,
  rmd-blue-grey-800: $rmd-blue-grey-800,
  rmd-blue-grey-900: $rmd-blue-grey-900,
  rmd-black-base: $rmd-black-base,
  rmd-white-base: $rmd-white-base,
);

variables.name: rmd-theme-primary
variables.description:
The primary theme color to use for your app. This is normally one of the material design colors with a `-500` suffix,
but it can be any color.

variables.name: rmd-theme-on-primary
variables.description:
The color to use when text should be displayed on the primary theme color. The default behavior is to test the primary color's
contrast tone. If the color is considered 'dark', `$rmd-white-base` will be used. Otherwise `$rmd-black-base` will be used. If
this isn't sufficient for your app, you can change this to be any color. Just make sure that it meets the contrast accessibility
requirements (3.1:1 ratio for large (18px regular or 14px bold) and 4.5:1 for normal text).

variables.name: rmd-theme-secondary
variables.description:
The secondary theme color to use for your app. This is normally one of the material design colors with an accent
suffix (`-a-100` or `-a-200` or `-a-400` or `-a-700`, but it can really be any color.

variables.name: rmd-theme-on-secondary
variables.description:
The color to use when text should be displayed on the secondary theme color. The default behavior is to test the secondary color's
contrast tone. If the color is considered 'dark', `$rmd-white-base` will be used. Otherwise `$rmd-black-base` will be used. If
this isn't sufficient for your app, you can change this to be any color. Just make sure that it meets the contrast accessibility
requirements (3.1:1 ratio for large (18px regular or 14px bold) and 4.5:1 for normal text).

variables.name: rmd-theme-warning
variables.description:
The warning theme color to use for your app. This isn't used by anything internally within react-md at this time, but it might
be helpful to have this variable defined as more things get developed.

variables.name: rmd-theme-on-warning
variables.description:
The color to use when text should be displayed on the warning theme color. The default behavior is to test the warning color's
contrast tone. If the color is considered 'dark', `$rmd-white-base` will be used. Otherwise `$rmd-black-base` will
be used. If this isn't sufficient for your app, you can change this to be any color. Just make sure that it meets the contrast
accessibility requirements (3.1:1 ratio for large (18px regular or 14px bold) and 4.5:1 for normal text).

variables.name: rmd-theme-error
variables.description: The error theme color to use for your app.

variables.name: rmd-theme-on-error
variables.description:
The color to use when text should be displayed on the warning theme color. The default behavior is to test the error color's
contrast tone. If the color is considered 'dark', `$rmd-white-base` will be used. Otherwise `$rmd-black-base` will
be used. If this isn't sufficient for your app, you can change this to be any color. Just make sure that it meets the contrast
accessibility requirements (3.1:1 ratio for large (18px regular or 14px bold) and 4.5:1 for normal text).

variables.name: rmd-theme-success
variables.description:
The success theme color to use for your app. This isn't used by anything internally within react-md at this time, but it might
be helpful to have this variable defined as more things get developed.

variables.name: rmd-theme-on-success
variables.description:
The color to use when text should be displayed on the warning theme color. The default behavior is to test the success color's
contrast tone. If the color is considered 'dark', `$rmd-white-base` will be used. Otherwise `$rmd-black-base` will
be used. If this isn't sufficient for your app, you can change this to be any color. Just make sure that it meets the contrast
accessibility requirements (3.1:1 ratio for large (18px regular or 14px bold) and 4.5:1 for normal text).

variables.name: rmd-theme-surface
variables.description:
The theme's surface background color. This is the background color that will be used for any temporary 'material' (or surface)

Ex: Dialogs, Lists

variables.name: rmd-theme-on-surface
variables.description:
The color to use when text should be displayed on a surface or temporary material. The default behavior is to test if the surface
color's contrast tone. If the color is considered 'dark', `$rd-white-base` will be used. Otherwise `$rmd-black-base` will
be used. If this isn't sufficient for your app, you can change this to be any color. Just make sure that it meets the contrast
accessibility requirements (3.1:1 ratio for large (18px regular or 14px bold) and 4.5:1 for normal text).

variables.name: rmd-theme-text-colors
variables.description:
A Map of all the text colors for the app. This will be Map of 'light' and 'dark' that has the following keys:
- primary
- secondary
- hint
- disabled
- icon

This is normally used along with the `rmd-theme-contrast-tone` and the `map-get` Sass functions
variables.code:
$rmd-theme-text-colors: (
  dark: (
    primary: rgba($rmd-black-base, .87),
    secondary: rgba($rmd-black-base, .54),
    hint: rgba($rmd-black-base, .34),
    disabled: rgba($rmd-black-base, .38),
    icon: rgba($rmd-black-base, .54),
  ),
  light: (
    primary: $rmd-white-base,
    secondary: rgba($rmd-white-base, .7),
    hint: rgba($rmd-white-base, .5),
    disabled: rgba($rmd-white-base, .5),
    icon: rgba($rmd-white-base, .7),
  ),
);

variables.name: rmd-theme-property-values
variables.description:
A Map of all the theme property values that can be used throughout the app. This is mainly created
so that the specific `rmd-theme--NAME` classes can be created, but also for the `rmd-theme-prop-value` function
to get a specific color within your theme.

usedBy.name: react-md-button
usedBy.description: Creates all the styles for buttons within react-md.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme
usedBy.description:
A small utility function to get a color from the current theme. This is normally used along with the
`rmd-theme-var` function so that both css variables and a fallback can be applied.

You are _most_ likely looking for the `rmd-theme` mixin and not the functions instead.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme-var
usedBy.description:
A small utility function to get a color from the current theme as a css variable. This is normally used along with the
`rmd-theme` function so that both css variables and a fallback can be applied.

You are _most_ likely looking for the `rmd-theme` mixin and not the functions instead.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme-set-var
usedBy.description:
This is an extremely simple mixin that will allow you to quickly set or update the value of a theme css variable
with the new provided value.

usedBy.name: react-md-theme
usedBy.description:
Creates all the styles for a theme in react-md. This will start by creating CSS Variables
for each theme variable and then create class names for each variable.

usedBy.name: rmd-theme-prop-value
usedBy.description:
Attempts to get a specific theme color based on the property provided.

If the property is a color or 'currentColor', it will be returned instead.

NOTE: This has to be defined in variables so there aren't recursive imports.

variables.code:
$rmd-theme-property-values: (
  background: $rmd-theme-background,
  primary: $rmd-theme-primary,
  on-primary: $rmd-theme-on-primary,
  secondary: $rmd-theme-secondary,
  on-secondary: $rmd-theme-on-secondary,
  surface: $rmd-theme-surface,
  on-surface: $rmd-theme-on-surface,
  warning: $rmd-theme-warning,
  on-warning: $rmd-theme-on-warning,
  error: $rmd-theme-error,
  on-error: $rmd-theme-on-error,
  success: $rmd-theme-success,
  on-success: $rmd-theme-on-success,
  text-primary-on-background: rmd-theme-text-color(primary, $rmd-theme-background),
  text-secondary-on-background: rmd-theme-text-color(secondary, $rmd-theme-background),
  text-hint-on-background: rmd-theme-text-color(hint, $rmd-theme-background),
  text-disabled-on-background: rmd-theme-text-color(disabled, $rmd-theme-background),
  text-icon-on-background: rmd-theme-text-color(icon, $rmd-theme-background),
  text-primary-on-light: rmd-theme-text-color(primary, light),
  text-secondary-on-light: rmd-theme-text-color(secondary, light),
  text-hint-on-light: rmd-theme-text-color(hint, light),
  text-disabled-on-light: rmd-theme-text-color(disabled, light),
  text-icon-on-light: rmd-theme-text-color(icon, light),
  text-primary-on-dark: rmd-theme-text-color(primary, dark),
  text-secondary-on-dark: rmd-theme-text-color(secondary, dark),
  text-hint-on-dark: rmd-theme-text-color(hint, dark),
  text-disabled-on-dark: rmd-theme-text-color(disabled, dark),
  text-icon-on-dark: rmd-theme-text-color(icon, dark),
);

variables.name: rmd-theme-edge-opt-out
variables.description: Boolean if the theme should opt-out of edge support by default with the provided mixins.
